products.name: SRS EHR
products.description: Comprehensive ambulatory specialty EHR and practice management system serving dermatology, ophthalmology, plastic surgery, orthopedics, and med spa practices. Includes clinical charting, e-prescribing, lab ordering, scheduling, billing, and patient communications.
products.notes: Formerly known as SRSPro. Uses CSV and XML exports for discrete data. Includes User Defined Fields (UDFs) for practice-specific customization. Certified for view/download/transmit (e)(3) rather than full patient portal.

products.name: Nextech EHR (IntelleChartPRO)
products.description: Comprehensive ambulatory specialty EHR and practice management system powered by the IntelleChartPRO platform. Serves dermatology, ophthalmology, plastic surgery, orthopedics, and med spa practices. Includes integrated patient portal with secure messaging, clinical documentation, practice management, and specialty-specific charting tools.
products.broader_product_name: Nextech Practice Management Suite (includes EHR, PM, patient portal, and potentially other modules)
products.notes: ICP = IntelleChartPRO. More advanced than SRS with patient portal (e)(1) certification and additional API capabilities (g)(9), (g)(10). Documentation notes some features are 'IntelleChartPRO only customers' suggesting possible product tiers or variants. Nextech also offers 'Nextech Select/NexCloud' with separate EHI documentation - relationship unclear.
sources: Nextech EHR (powered by IntelleChartPRO) EHI Export Documentation PDF

notes: Nextech appears to have multiple product lines (SRS, IntelleChartPRO/ICP, Nextech Select/NexCloud) with unclear relationships. Both certified products serve the same five specialties (dermatology, ophthalmology, plastic surgery, orthopedics, med spa), so product differentiation is likely based on platform generation, deployment model, or feature sets rather than specialty focus. Nextech emphasizes integrated EHR + practice management with revenue cycle, patient engagement, and specialty-specific workflows. As a specialty EHR vendor, they likely have deep specialty-specific features (e.g., ophthalmology refractions/glaucoma tracking, dermatology body diagrams, plastic surgery photo management, cosmetic treatment packages) that may or may not be fully represented in generic export folder structures. Company recognized as '2024 Best in KLAS: Ambulatory Specialty EHR' and holds AAD DataDerm Gold Recognition. Recently promoted AI Scribe (Cora Scribe) for clinical documentation - storage/integration of AI-generated content unclear.
